markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 8"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Show-Off](/Feats.aspx?ID=4144) <actions string="Free Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Flourish" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=73" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Firebrands](/Sources.aspx?ID=196) pg. 80</row>

**Archetype** [Acrobat](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=45)

**Frequency**
once per minute

**Prerequisites**
[Acrobat Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1873)

**Access**
Members of the Firebrands at the rank of second mark or higher have access to this feat.

**Trigger**
You succeed at an [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) or [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check deemed suitably challenging and meaningful by the GM.

</column>

---

As is the tradition with many Firebrands, you call your shot and look to impress with an extra bit of panache or a greater stunt. Attempt the triggering check again, using the second result. On a success, you gain the normal results of the check, plus you feel invigorated by your stunt and gain temporary Hit Points equal to your level (double your level on a critical success). You lose any remaining temporary Hit Points after 1 minute. Typically, a challenging task is one with at least a [standard DC for your level](/Rules.aspx?ID=554), though the difficulty may be higher depending on the situation. A meaningful context is one where the action's success or failure is relevant to the pursuit of your goals.
